SEARCH
Package org.bukkit.inventory.view

Interface BeaconView

All Superinterfaces:
InventoryView
public interface BeaconView extends InventoryView
An instance of InventoryView which provides extra methods related to beacon view data.

  • Method Details

    • getTopInventory

      @NotNull @NotNull BeaconInventory getTopInventory()
      Description copied from interface: InventoryView
      Get the upper inventory involved in this transaction.
      Specified by:
      getTopInventory in interface InventoryView
      Returns:
      the inventory

    • getTier

      int getTier()
      Gets the tier of the beacon

      Beacon tier is deduced by the height of the pyramid the beacon is standing on. The level of the beacon is 0 unless the beacon is activated.

      Returns:
      The tier of the beacon

    • getPrimaryEffect

      @Nullable @Nullable PotionEffectType getPrimaryEffect()
      Gets the primary effect of the beacon.

      If the beacon level is high enough where the primary effect can be upgraded to level two, e.g. Speed 2. Instead of getSecondaryEffect() being null it getSecondaryEffect() returns the same PotionEffectType as this method.

      Returns:
      The primary effect enabled on the beacon

    • getSecondaryEffect

      @Nullable @Nullable PotionEffectType getSecondaryEffect()
      Gets the secondary effect of the beacon.

      If the beacon level is high enough where the primary effect can be upgraded to level two, e.g. Speed 2. The secondary effect will return the same effect as getPrimaryEffect().

      Returns:
      The secondary effect enabled on the beacon

    • setPrimaryEffect

      void setPrimaryEffect(@Nullable @Nullable PotionEffectType effect)
      Sets the primary effect of the beacon, or null to clear

      The PotionEffectType provided must be one that is already within the beacon as a valid option.

      1. PotionEffectType.SPEED
      2. PotionEffectType.HASTE
      3. PotionEffectType.RESISTANCE
      4. PotionEffectType.JUMP_BOOST
      5. PotionEffectType.STRENGTH
      6. PotionEffectType.REGENERATION
      Parameters:
      effect - desired primary effect

    • setSecondaryEffect

      void setSecondaryEffect(@Nullable @Nullable PotionEffectType effect)
      Sets the secondary effect on this beacon, or null to clear. Note that tier must be >= 4 and a primary effect must be set in order for this effect to be active.

      The PotionEffectType provided must be one that is already within the beacon as a valid option.

      1. PotionEffectType.SPEED
      2. PotionEffectType.HASTE
      3. PotionEffectType.RESISTANCE
      4. PotionEffectType.JUMP_BOOST
      5. PotionEffectType.STRENGTH
      6. PotionEffectType.REGENERATION
      Parameters:
      effect - the desired secondary effect
